snippet: In years past during budget-making season, Tom Orloff, the chief assistant district attorney here, would amble across the street to the Alameda County administration building and plead, wheedle and threaten until he got enough money for his depart...
lead_paragraph: In years past during budget-making season, Tom Orloff, the chief assistant district attorney here, would amble across the street to the Alameda County administration building and plead, wheedle and threaten until he got enough money for his department to survive. But this year, Mr. Orloff said, "even if we fight and scratch and claw on the county level, we'll still get killed" because of Gov. Pete Wilson's plan to balance the state's $52 billion budget by commandeering $2.6 billion in local property taxes.

headline.main: Cash Woes Cast A Long Shadow Over California
